metadata.name: Patient Home Screen Design Tokens
metadata.description: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant teal/green theme for Patient Home Screen UI
metadata.author: Design System

primary.name: Primary Deep Teal
primary.useCase: Permanent header color, deep accents, strong emphasis, icon glyphs

secondary.name: Secondary Medium Teal
secondary.useCase: Gradient mid-stop, CTAs, active states, secondary emphasis

accent.name: Accent Soft Greenish
accent.useCase: Icon pills, status chips, subtle accents, soft backgrounds

lightTint.name: Light Background Tint
lightTint.useCase: Card/pill backgrounds, subtle surfaces, icon pill background

pageBg.name: Page Background
pageBg.useCase: App page background outside white cards/surfaces

textPrimary.name: Text Primary (Near-Black)
textPrimary.useCase: Body text on white cards, high contrast primary text

textSecondary.name: Text Secondary (Gray)
textSecondary.useCase: Secondary text, muted labels, helper text

textLight.name: Text Light (White)
textLight.useCase: Text on dark/teal backgrounds, high contrast light text

shadow.name: Shadow
shadow.useCase: Subtle shadows on cards, depth indicators

headerGradient.name: Header Gradient
headerGradient.useCase: Header background, covering entire header area

icon_pill.useCase: Rounded mint pill backgrounds with primary icon glyph

tested_pairs.name: Header Text (White) vs Gradient Start (#096E68)
tested_pairs.note: High contrast, text is legible. Text shadow optional but recommended for subtle enhancement.

tested_pairs.name: Header Text (White) vs Gradient End (#0EA388)
tested_pairs.note: Meets AA standard. At gradient midpoint (blend), ratio remains >= 5.5:1.

tested_pairs.name: CTA Text (White) vs CTA Background (#0EA388)
tested_pairs.note: Meets AA standard for button text.

tested_pairs.name: Icon Glyph (#096E68) vs Icon Pill (#BEE5DF)
tested_pairs.note: Excellent contrast for small icons (20px). Exceeds WCAG AAA for all icon sizes.

tested_pairs.name: Body Text (#073936) vs Card Background (#FFFFFF)
tested_pairs.note: Near-black text on white. Exceeds AAA standard for readability.

tested_pairs.name: Secondary Text (#5A6F6E) vs Card Background (#FFFFFF)
tested_pairs.note: Meets AA for body copy. Suitable for secondary information.

tested_pairs.name: Primary Button Text (#096E68) vs White Background (#FFFFFF)
tested_pairs.note: Outline button with teal text on white. High contrast.

tested_pairs.name: Accent Soft Text (#7AADA7) vs White Background (#FFFFFF)
tested_pairs.recommendation: Do not use #7AADA7 for body text. Use as background/pill color only. For text, prefer #096E68 or #5A6F6E.

recommendations.issue: Accent color (#7AADA7) fails contrast as text on white
recommendations.solution: Use #7AADA7 only as background/pill color. For any text using accent, switch to Primary (#096E68) or Secondary Gray (#5A6F6E).

recommendations.issue: Header text on gradient mid-stop (#0EA388) is borderline at 5.8:1
recommendations.solution: Optional: add subtle text-shadow (0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.2)) for additional contrast cushion and polish.

recommendations.issue: Secondary text (#5A6F6E) on white is at lower AA boundary (5.2:1)
recommendations.solution: Use for secondary/muted text only (labels, hints, timestamps). For important secondary info, consider darker text (#073936) or maintain 5.2:1 minimum.
